alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Albany and southern Platte Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 500 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Westview Circle to 17 miles north of Baldy Peak. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wheatland, Chugcreek, Lakeview North, Bordeaux, Westview Circle, Y-O Ranch, Grayrocks Reservoir and Slater. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 64 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County
